paper_abstract: New techniques allow for more efficient boundary integral algorithms to compute the Dirichlet-Neumann map for Laplace's equation in two-dimensional exterior domains. Novelties include a new post-processor which reduces the need for discretization points with 50%, a new integral equation which reduces the error for resolved geometries with a factor equal to the system size, systematic use of regularization which reduces the error even further, and adaptive mesh generation based on kernel resolution. (C) 2009 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Faster convergence and higher accuracy for the Dirichlet-Neumann map
